title: Teston Bridge Country Park Walking Route

images.title: Nick Smith / The River Medway from Teston Bridge
images.caption: The River Medway from Teston Bridge. Note the pedestrian 'refuge', one of several along this narrow bridge.

images.title: Colin Smith / Teston Bridge
images.caption: Teston Bridge. Medieval stone bridge over the River Medway. Note the enlarged arch for the benefit of barge traffic.

images.title: Nigel Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Entrance to the country park with the car park in the background.

images.title: Jane Gilbert / River Medway from Teston weir
images.caption: A view of the River Medway whilst standing next to the weir in the park.

images.title: Nigel Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Swans and boats on the River Medway east of Bow bridge, Wateringbury

images.title: Kevin Reynolds / Cattle grazing at Teston
images.caption: Cattle conservation grazing at Teston Bridge Picnic site, at Kent County Council run park west of Maidstone. They are Shetland highland breed.

description: This country park is set around the picturesque 14th century Teston Bridge on the banks of the River Medway in Teston, near Maidstone. A variety of wildlife can be spotted here – look out for otters which can be seen along the river. The circular walk starts at the car park next to Teston Bridge and heads along the river to the village of Wateringbury, before crossing the River and returning to the start point on the opposite side.
